author: protolambda
content: The planned test time of steklo devnet has passed, I'm shutting down the fork monitor and our nodes. Having 7 clients on the net, and reaching consensus after inevitable bugfixes, was very exciting. Thank you to everyone who contributed to this! Now it's time for spec testing + work on sync stability + improved beacon/validator setups to get ready for to the next devnet. We'll soon update the merge-tutorial with an automated local testnet setup, and make a specs alpha-release with Merge test vectors.

author: clefru
content: <@203220829473996800> thanks for your mergenet-tutorial. Would you be interested in a dockerized environment to run the top half of your tutorial? The "Create chain configurations"/"Prepare Eth2 data" steps? That would avoid people having to dance the setup of pip/golang inside Ubuntu (that's what I chose)

author: protolambda
content: <@381414973747757059> That's the part that people like to change most I think, to customize the local net. There's an open PR with a script to run through it all. We could put that in docker, but we need it to be customizable, not a black box. Hence also all the instructions to build and run from source, so people can tweak things. Maybe there's some balance with configs you can mount, and a dockerfile that documents the  process? You're welcome to make PRs with your ideas

author: clefru
content: <@203220829473996800> I don't think that I want to mingle with/automate the individual steps too much. You can "docker run -t clefruDockerContainer /bin/bash -v ${PWD}/$TESTNET_NAME:/network" and then operate inside the container but still on the mapped file path. I just want to get go install/pip install -r requirements.txt out of the way.

author: schone_wizard
content: so where to next from Steklo?
